title: Werkplaats Typografie??? [...continued]
content:
this is a follow up posting from my last one a few weeks ago...  
I’m having a heck of a time getting in touch with Werkplaats Typografie through emails, phone calls, and faxes  
RE:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/16034](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709005006/http:/typophile.com/node/16034 "http://typophile.com/node/16034")

has anyone from the Open Day presentation gotten any info or oculd pass mine along...

or i guess i would have to find a way to get in touch with Peter Bilak or Robin Kinross

thanx again

 [‹ typefaces with high x-height](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709005006/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16270 "Go to previous forum topic") [Zapfino, now with OpenType contextual features! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709005006/http:/www.typophile.com/node/8122 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Mak

comments.content:
Peter Bilak has his own foundry, see: [www.typotheque.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709005006/http:/www.typotheque.com/ "www.typotheque.com") Here you can find ways of getting in touch with him.

Regards,  
Diederik

Look after Goodness & Truth  
& Beauty will look after itself

Hi Kevin,

I am sorry, I said that I was going to post all the info I got from the open day but I didn’t go. I got in touch with different students from WT via email and they told me it wasn’t worth visiting the open day. I was adviced to take a separate appointement.  
I’ve also had trouble getting in touch with WT although I haven’t tried to phone them yet (I’ve been told that the staff is only in one day a week, I don’t know which day though). I asked a series of questions via email to a couple of students and they have answered most of my queries.  
I guess this doesn’t help you much, good luck anyway!

no worries.. thanks anyways  
i’ll try my luck with mr bilak or kinross
